channel.title: Stuck at "Checking for updates - 1%" on 718 Client
channel.description:
I am hosting the server on a VPS and have I have the VPS ip and port put in Loader.java on the client. The server runs fine (I'm using PowerSurge 742) but the client just stays at "Checking for updates - 1%". Is there a place where I am supposed to put a cache.zip www link? If there is where is it? And can I just use an uppit link for it?
Any help would be greatly appreciated and will be rep++ worthy.

item.title: Stuck at "Checking for updates - 1%" on 718 Client
item.dc:creator: @Wife_Beater Wife Beater
item.description:
@Wife_Beater wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:3, topic:507443”]Like what Si Force said; use a direct link, preferably dropbox.
Also, caches in those revisions are handled from the source. I’ve never looked at the file setup in that source, so I’m afraid I can’t tell you where.
Also, make sure that you are running your client on localhost.[/quote]

Ok well I will use dropbox, but I have literally looked for where to put the link in every class, with no luck. Any idea where to go from here?

My server loads the cache from data/cache, and runs smoothly…

Read full topic
item.source: Stuck at "Checking for updates - 1%" on 718 Client

item.title: Stuck at "Checking for updates - 1%" on 718 Client
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Like what Si Force said; use a direct link, preferably dropbox.
Also, caches in those revisions are handled from the source. I’ve never looked at the file setup in that source, so I’m afraid I can’t tell you where.
Also, make sure that you are running your client on localhost.

Read full topic
item.source: Stuck at "Checking for updates - 1%" on 718 Client

item.title: Stuck at "Checking for updates - 1%" on 718 Client
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I’m not sure what file the cache link to the cache goes in, as I’m not really familiar with that revision at all, but I doubt you could use an uppit link. It’d be best if you had a direct-download link.

Read full topic
